newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH COSUN WINS CONTROL OF SLOVENIA SUGAR REFINER.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH COSUN WINS CONTROL OF SLOVENIA SUGAR REFINER.

text.p: Dutch sugar group Cosun said on Tuesday it had increased its stake in Slovenian sugar refiner Tovarna sladkorja Ormoz d.d. to a majority holding, gaining a foothold in what it sees as a potentially lucrative market.
Cosun, a Dutch sugar, fruit and foodstuffs co-operative formerly known as Suiker Unie, last year began building a stake in the Slovenian refiner, which was privatised two years ago.

"There are few growth prospects left in the European Union and there are 100 million consumers in eastern Europe," Cosun spokeswoman Willy van Oorschot told Reuters. "We want to use our experience in marketing and selling sugar."
She said Cosun purchased Tovarna shares from insitutional investors and on the over-the-counter section of the Ljubljana bourse. She estimated the stake at somewhere near 54 percent.
"We may look at increasing this figure but we do not want to control 100 percent," Van Oorschot added.
Tovarna has the capacity to process some 4,000 tonnes of sugar beet a day, and in 1996 produced 70,000 tonnes of white sugar, Cosun said in a statement.
The factory has a workforce of some 330 and an annual turnover of 75 million guilders.
